#ABquestions 💭 سؤال

WE DON'T WONDER ANYMORE | ما عدنا نتأمل

I read an article recently that talked about how in our current times we don't #wonder anymore. We don't even know how to sit down in silence with ourselves without distracting ourselves with our #smartphones, #socialmedia, #music, and so forth. 📱💻🕹📺🎼
__
I'll give you a few examples. Say you're sitting with friends at dinner; the moment the chatting stops, I BET YOU, you won't even get to count till 10 before everyone has already started using their phones. When you get on elevators, people don't even wait 2 SECONDS, before they even take out their phones and start doing whatever on it to avoid the #silence or #awkwardness. Since when does silence have to equal awkwardness? BATHROOMS! We don't even go to bathrooms anymore without taking our phones with us! Can you believe that!?
__
Have we reached a point where we can't just sit alone with ourselves? Have we reached a point where we can't even tolerate our own selves? We don't know how to sit-down, #selfreflect, #brainstorm, wonder? Those moments are SUCH important moments, where we often find #solutions to #problems, where we are #creative, where we #destress and gather our thoughts. 🤔💭
__
Let me know your thoughts on this topic from your own experiences? From your own #alone time and daily reflection? How can we make sure we don't lose that to continuous distractions?
__
أنتظر آرائكم في الموضوع. 🤔

2 weeks, 500 μL, 1 sample. That's what you are looking at. ⠀
.⠀
Before I've posted those flasks of 'butterbeer' (as we call them in the lab), which really aren't butterbeer (unfortunately) but the cells we express our protein in find this solution delicious none the less. The media has all the nutrients needed for the cells to grow, like sugars, salts, metals, many things we also intake that are necessary for our biological process. ⠀
.⠀
The next step is to take that media, pellet it down (when the cells experience centfriguation - an amusement park like experience 😉) and collect those pellets for further purification.⠀
.⠀
Then there's a serious of chromatography steps where you take a solid and liquid phase of mixed cells and debris in order to separate only the parts you need. Its kinda like making coffee, you have grinds and add water and then filter them, collecting only the delicious liquid phase.⠀
.⠀
Further steps are done to purify that liquid stage so it has just what you want it in and then to get it just the concentration you want to do your experiments.⠀
.⠀
This takes about two weeks in the laboratory from start to finish and can give you an idea about why science can be slow and time consuming. The exciting part is what comes out of the pure sample in the tiny tube. Right now I'm working on my fifth attempt to make a crystallized form of my protein for structural analysis. (no, don't do math - it has taken quite a bit of time!) ⠀
.⠀
2 weeks, 500 μL, 1 sample. 5 years (aaah!)
